snippet: A study from the McKinsey Global Institute examines the effects of quantitative easing by central banks in the United States and Europe, finding the policy to have been a double-edged sword.
abstract: A study from the McKinsey Global Institute examines the effects of quantitative easing by central banks in the United States and Europe, finding the policy to have been a double-edged sword.
lead_paragraph: As Wall Street tries to gauge when the Federal Reserve might start tapering its stimulus program, a new study from the McKinsey Global Institute illustrates just how deep the impact of such efforts has been since 2007. But it also makes clear that the benefits haven’t been distributed equally.
